entry.name: biological entity
entry.definition: material entity that was or is a living organism

entry.name: entity
entry.definition: concrete or abstract thing that exists, did exist, or might exist, including associations among these things

entry.name: immaterial entity
entry.definition: entity that does not occupy three-dimensional space

entry.name: material entity
entry.definition: entity that occupies three-dimensional space

entry.name: non-biological entity
entry.definition: material entity that is not and has never been a living organism

entry.name: person
entry.definition: biological entity that is a human being

entry.name: cooperative ITS
entry.definition: subset of ITS where information is shared among ITS stations in a manner that enables its use by multiple ITS services

entry.name: cooperative ITS
entry.definition: subset of ITS where information is shared among ITS stations in a manner that enables its use by multiple ITS services

entry.name: cooperative ITS
entry.definition: subset of ITS where information is shared among ITS stations in a manner that enables its use by multiple ITS services

entry.name: intelligent transport system
entry.definition: system comprised of information, communication, sensor, and control technologies and that is designed to benefit a surface transport system

entry.name: intelligent transport system
entry.definition: system comprised of information, communication, sensor, and control technologies and that is designed to benefit a surface transport system

entry.name: intelligent transport system
entry.definition: system comprised of information, communication, sensor, and control technologies and that is designed to benefit a surface transport system

entry.name: intelligent transport system
entry.definition: system comprised of information, communication, sensor, and control technologies and that is designed to benefit a surface transport system

entry.name: surface transport system
entry.definition: transport system designed to move material entities across the surface or near-surface of the Earth

entry.name: system
entry.definition: combination of interacting elements organized to achieve one or more stated purposes

entry.name: transport system
entry.definition: system of infrastructure elements and optionally vehicles that jointly are designed to move material entities from an origin to a destination

entry.name: architecture
entry.definition: <system> fundamental concepts or properties of a system in its environment embodied in its elements, relationships, and in the principles of its design and evolution

entry.name: architecture
entry.definition: <system> fundamental concepts or properties of a system in its environment embodied in its elements, relationships, and in the principles of its design and evolution

entry.name: architecture description
entry.definition: work product used to express an architecture

entry.name: architecture framework
entry.definition: conventions, principles and practices for the description of architectures established within a specific domain of application and/or community of stakeholders

entry.name: architecture model
entry.definition: work product representing one or more architecture views and expressed in a format governed by a model kind

entry.name: architecture view
entry.definition: work product expressing the architecture of a system from the perspective of specific system concerns

entry.name: architecture viewpoint
entry.definition: work product establishing the conventions for the construction, interpretation and use of architecture views to frame specific system concerns

entry.name: concern
entry.definition: <system> interest in a system relevant to one or more of its stakeholders

entry.name: element
entry.definition: <architecture> component member of an architecture model included in an architecture view

entry.name: environment
entry.definition: <system> context determining the setting and circumstances of all influences upon a system

entry.name: model kind
entry.definition: conventions for a type of modelling

entry.name: stakeholder
entry.definition: <system> individual, team, organization, or classes thereof, having an interest in a system

entry.name: stakeholder
entry.definition: <system> individual, team, organization, or classes thereof, having an interest in a system

entry.name: communications view
entry.definition: architecture view from the communications viewpoint

entry.name: communications viewpoint
entry.definition: architecture viewpoint used to frame concerns related to all layers of the OSI stack and related management and security issues

entry.name: enterprise view
entry.definition: architecture view from the enterprise viewpoint

entry.name: enterprise viewpoint
entry.definition: architecture viewpoint used to frame the policies, funding incentives, working arrangements, and jurisdictional structure that support the technical layers of the architecture

entry.name: functional view
entry.definition: architecture view from the functional viewpoint

entry.name: functional viewpoint
entry.definition: architecture viewpoint used to frame concerns related to the definition of processes that perform surface transport functions and data flows shared between these processes

entry.name: physical view
entry.definition: architecture view from the physical viewpoint

entry.name: physical view
entry.definition: architecture view from the physical viewpoint

entry.name: physical viewpoint
entry.definition: architecture viewpoint used to frame concerns related to the assignment of functionality to physical objects and the interfaces among these physical objects

entry.name: access layer
entry.definition: protocol layer that contains the open systems interconnect (OSI) physical and data link layer protocols

entry.name: application entity
entry.definition: <ITS-S> part of the ITS station reference architecture that is responsible for providing ITS-related functionality

entry.name: facilities layer
entry.definition: <ITS-S> protocol layer in the ITS station reference architecture containing the open systems interconnect (OSI) session, presentation, and application layer protocols

entry.name: facilities layer
entry.definition: <ITS-S> protocol layer in the ITS station reference architecture containing the open systems interconnect (OSI) session, presentation, and application layer protocols

entry.name: facilities layer
entry.definition: <ITS-S> protocol layer in the ITS station reference architecture containing the open systems interconnect (OSI) session, presentation, and application layer protocols

entry.name: ITS-S access layer
entry.definition: <ITS-S> protocol layer in the ITS station reference architecture containing the open systems interconnect (OSI) physical and data link layer protocols for ITS communications

entry.name: management entity
entry.definition: <ITS-S> part of the ITS station reference architecture that is responsible for management of communications and configuration information for the local physical object and possibly remote physical objects

entry.name: security entity
entry.definition: <ITS-S> part of the ITS station reference architecture that is responsible for providing privacy, communication security, and system security

entry.name: transnet layer
entry.definition: <ITS-S> protocol layer in the ITS station reference architecture containing the open systems interconnect (OSI) network and transport layer protocols

entry.name: transnet layer
entry.definition: <ITS-S> protocol layer in the ITS station reference architecture containing the open systems interconnect (OSI) network and transport layer protocols

entry.name: document
entry.definition: uniquely identified unit of information for human use

entry.name: enterprise object
entry.definition: element within an enterprise view that represents an organization or individual

entry.name: extends
entry.definition: <enterprise view> relationship where one resource supplements another resource

entry.name: formal coordination
entry.definition: <enterprise view> interaction between two enterprise objects governed by a documented agreement

entry.name: includes
entry.definition: <enterprise view> relationship where one resource contains another resource

entry.name: informal coordination
entry.definition: <enterprise view> interaction between two enterprise objects governed by an understanding that is not documented in a formal agreement between the two parties

entry.name: interaction
entry.definition: <enterprise view> element that represents coordination between two enterprise objects

entry.name: relationship
entry.definition: <enterprise view> element that represents an association between two resources

entry.name: resource
entry.definition: <enterprise view> element that represents an entity that is managed, operated, referenced, and/or used to develop and provide ITS

entry.name: role
entry.definition: <enterprise view> element that represents the specified responsibilities between an enterprise object and another enterprise view element

entry.name: data flow
entry.definition: representation of data flowing between two processes or between a process and a terminator

entry.name: function
entry.definition: <functional view> series of actions or activities performed by some object to achieve a goal

entry.name: process
entry.definition: <functional view> series of one or more functions in support of an ITS service

entry.name: process specification
entry.definition: document that defines a lowest-level process

entry.name: functional object
entry.definition: set of related processes that are performed by a physical object to fulfil aspects of an ITS service

entry.name: information flow
entry.definition: information that is exchanged between physical objects

entry.name: information transfer
entry.definition: information flow from a physical object acting as an information provider and sent to another physical object acting as an information consumer

entry.name: ITS component
entry.definition: physical object that has been assigned one or more functional objects in the provision of one or more ITS services

entry.name: physical object
entry.definition: <physical view> abstraction of a material entity that interacts with other abstract material entities in the provision of ITS services

entry.name: terminator
entry.definition: entity that is external to the ITS service implementation but with which the implementation communicates either to obtain inputs or to which it can send outputs

entry.name: deployment architecture
entry.definition: architecture that provides a vision of a specific deployment of a system within a geographic area

entry.name: ITS deployment architecture
entry.definition: deployment architecture for one or more ITS services

entry.name: ITS planning architecture
entry.definition: planning architecture for one or more ITS services

entry.name: ITS reference architecture
entry.definition: reference architecture for one or more ITS services

entry.name: ITS-S reference architecture
entry.definition: reference architecture for handling communications within a physical object as defined in ISO 21217

entry.name: planning architecture
entry.definition: architecture that provides a long-term vision of system elements that may be deployed and managed by different projects and/or entities within a geographic area

entry.name: reference architecture
entry.definition: architecture that provides a template solution for planning and deployment architectures

entry.name: data concept
entry.definition: data element, class, value domain, data frame, message, interface dialogue, or data dictionary defined, at a minimum, with an unambiguous identifier and a definition

entry.name: data concept
entry.definition: data element, class, value domain, data frame, message, interface dialogue, or data dictionary defined, at a minimum, with an unambiguous identifier and a definition

entry.name: data concept
entry.definition: data element, class, value domain, data frame, message, interface dialogue, or data dictionary defined, at a minimum, with an unambiguous identifier and a definition

entry.name: data concept registry
entry.definition: electronic data dictionary that follows precise documented rules for the registration and management of stored data concepts

entry.name: data dictionary
entry.definition: collection of data concept that allows lookup by entity identifier

entry.name: meta-attribute
entry.definition: documenting characteristic of a data concept that is stored in a data dictionary

entry.name: class
entry.definition: set of ideas, abstractions or things in the real world that are identified with explicit boundaries and meaning and whose properties and behaviour follow the same rules

entry.name: data element
entry.definition: unit of data that is considered in context to be indivisible and which includes an unambiguous representational form

entry.name: data frame
entry.definition: specific grouping of data elements that describes information of interest through a useful grouping of more atomic properties about one or more classes

entry.name: data frame

entry.name: data frame
entry.definition: specific grouping of data elements that describes information of interest through a useful grouping of more atomic properties about one or more classes

entry.name: interface dialogue
entry.definition: bi-directional communication sequence between two parties in accordance with predetermined protocols

entry.name: message
entry.definition: grouping of data elements, data frames, or data elements and data frames that is used to convey a complete set of information

entry.name: value domain
entry.definition: a set of permissible values

entry.definition: a set of permissible values

entry.name: role
entry.definition: specified responsibilities

entry.name: scenario
entry.definition: <use case> a description of the sequence of events from the user's perspective to perform a task in a specified context

entry.name: scenario
entry.definition: <use case> a description of the sequence of events from the user's perspective to perform a task in a specified context

entry.name: use case
entry.definition: description of the behavioural requirements of a system and its interaction with a user

entry.definition: description of the behavioural requirements of a system and its interaction with a user

entry.name: duration
entry.definition: time between two instants

entry.name: instant
entry.definition: zero-dimensional geographic primitive representing position in time

entry.name: central system
entry.definition: ITS component that provides application, management, and/or administrative functions from a centralized location (i.e., not at the roadside)

entry.name: field system
entry.definition: infrastructure-based ITS component located outside of a data centre that is designed to provide local processing or routing services while stationary

entry.name: field system
entry.definition: infrastructure-based ITS component located outside of a data centre that is designed to provide local processing or routing services while stationary

entry.name: personal system
entry.definition: ITS component, other than a vehicle system, that is used by a person in relation to a past, current, or upcoming journey

entry.name: support system
entry.definition: ITS component that provides services in support of one or more other ITS components

entry.name: vehicle system
entry.definition: ITS component that is installed as a component of a vehicle

entry.name: emergency management central system
entry.definition: central system that allows an entity to manage and respond to crashes, events, disasters, evacuation orders, and other incidents

entry.name: emergency management central system
entry.definition: central system that allows an entity to manage and respond to crashes, events, disasters, evacuation orders, and other incidents

entry.name: fleet and freight management central system
entry.definition: central system that allows a fleet or freight operator to manage and control its personnel, equipment, and/or freight

entry.name: maintenance and construction central management system

entry.name: payment administration central system

entry.name: public transport central management system

entry.name: traffic management central system
entry.definition: central system that monitors and controls traffic and the road network

entry.name: traffic regulation central system
entry.definition: central system that officially records traffic regulations in electronic form so that they can be distributed to other systems

entry.name: transport information central system

entry.name: carriageway
entry.definition: contiguous area of roadway along a road segment

entry.name: driving space
entry.definition: area above the roadway that is primarily intended for the movement of vehicles

entry.name: dual carriageway road segment
entry.definition: roadway comprised of exactly two carriageways

entry.name: hardstanding
entry.definition: part of a paved carriageway that is not a traffic lane, hard shoulder, or lay-by.

entry.name: lane
entry.definition: <generic> portion of the road reservation designed to accommodate a single line of moving material entities along its length

entry.name: lay-by
entry.definition: short length of paved carriageway at its edge designed to allow a vehicle to draw out of the travel lanes and stop temporarily

entry.name: multiple carriageway road segment
entry.definition: roadway comprised of more than two carriageways

entry.name: reserved lane
entry.definition: traffic lane restricted to a specific subset of road vehicles or user categories

entry.name: road reservation
entry.definition: area legally reserved for road transport purposes and support

entry.name: roadside
entry.definition: portion of the road reservation excluding all roadways and driving spaces

entry.name: roadway
entry.definition: part of the surface of the road reservation primarily designed for the movement of vehicles that comply with a specified set of requirements

entry.name: shoulder
entry.definition: either a hard shoulder or a soft shoulder

entry.name: single carriageway road segment
entry.definition: roadway comprised of exactly one carriageway

entry.name: traffic lane
entry.definition: portion of carriageway designed to accommodate a single line of moving road vehicles

entry.name: travelled way
entry.definition: part of the roadway that is currently intended for transport purposes

entry.name: travelled way
entry.definition: part of the roadway that is currently intended for transport purposes

entry.name: usable width
entry.definition: all traffic lanes of a carriageway

entry.name: verge
entry.definition: unpaved part of the roadside designed for travel safety purposes

entry.name: Jersey barrier
entry.definition: physical traffic separator that consists of a wall with a wide, sloped base designed to divert vehicles back into their traffic lane

entry.name: physical traffic separator
entry.definition: mechanism used to physically separate carriageways

entry.name: cycle lane
entry.definition: lane designed for the through movement of cycles

entry.name: cycleway
entry.definition: infrastructure primarily designed for the use of cycles and separate from a carriageway

entry.name: footway
entry.definition: lane primarily designed for the movement of pedestrians

entry.name: hard shoulder for emergency use
entry.definition: operating mode of a hard shoulder that allows operation of emergency, construction, maintenance, or other special use vehicles or for emergency stopping and is prohibited for other vehicle usage

entry.name: hard shoulder running
entry.definition: operating mode of a hard shoulder that allows operation of general-purpose vehicles as an extra lane

entry.name: egress lane
entry.definition: traffic lane designed for exiting a junction

entry.name: egress link
entry.definition: all egress lanes on a road link

entry.name: grade separated manoeuvre
entry.definition: manoeuvre that is vertically separated from one or more manoeuvres that cross its two-dimensional path

entry.name: ingress lane
entry.definition: traffic lane designed for entering a junction

entry.name: ingress lane
entry.definition: traffic lane designed for entering a junction

entry.name: ingress link
entry.definition: all ingress lanes on a road link

entry.name: interchange
entry.definition: junction with at least one grade separated manoeuvre

entry.name: intersection
entry.definition: space where two or more roads meet or cross

entry.name: intersection manoeuvre
entry.definition: <junction> movement from an ingress lane to an egress lane

entry.name: intersection manoeuvre
entry.definition: <junction> movement from an ingress lane to an egress lane

entry.name: junction
entry.definition: intersection that allows travellers to change roads

entry.name: junction at-grade
entry.definition: junction without any grade separated manoeuvres

entry.name: area location
entry.definition: spatial location enclosed within two-dimensional boundary/boundaries across a defined surface

entry.name: linear location
entry.definition: spatial location that extends between two point locations along a defined path

entry.name: location
entry.definition: particular place or position

entry.name: point location
entry.definition: spatial location with no length in any of the spatial dimensions

entry.name: spatial location
entry.definition: location within three-dimensional space

entry.name: spatial location
entry.definition: location within three-dimensional space

entry.name: dynamic spatial reference
entry.definition: spatial reference generated on-the-fly based on geographic properties in a digital map database

entry.name: dynamic spatial reference
entry.definition: spatial reference generated on-the-fly based on geographic properties in a digital map database

entry.name: gazetteer
entry.definition: register of spatial references of one or more location sub-types containing some information regarding position

entry.name: geographic identifier
entry.definition: spatial reference in the form of a label or code

entry.definition: spatial reference in the form of a label or code

entry.name: link location
entry.definition: pre-coded spatial reference defined within the road network database

entry.name: location referencing
entry.definition: process used to develop a spatial reference

entry.name: pre-coded spatial reference
entry.definition: spatial reference using a unique identifier that is agreed upon in both sender and receiver system to select a location from a set of pre-coded locations

entry.name: pre-coded spatial reference
entry.definition: spatial reference using a unique identifier that is agreed upon in both sender and receiver system to select a location from a set of pre-coded locations

entry.name: spatial reference
entry.definition: description of a spatial location in the real world according to a defined reference system

entry.name: user need
entry.definition: factor or condition necessary to achieve desired results within a specified context of use

entry.name: transport need
entry.definition: <transport> need to transport one or more transport items to a different location

entry.name: transport provider
entry.definition: <transport> entity that delivers one or more transport services

entry.definition: <transport> entity that delivers one or more transport services

entry.name: transport service
entry.definition: <transport> service that delivers one or more material entities from one location to another to satisfy a transport need

entry.name: transport user
entry.definition: <transport> consumer that has a transport need to be fulfilled

entry.name: ITS service
entry.definition: functionality that fulfils one or more ITS user needs

entry.name: ITS service
entry.definition: functionality that fulfils one or more ITS user needs

entry.definition: functionality that fulfils one or more ITS user needs

entry.definition: functionality that fulfils one or more ITS user needs

entry.name: ITS service provider
entry.definition: entity that delivers one or more ITS services

entry.name: ITS user
entry.definition: entity that has an ITS user need to be fulfilled

entry.name: ITS user need
entry.definition: need of an entity external to the intelligent transport system for a surface transport system benefit that can be met with the use of information, communication, sensor, and/or control technologies

entry.name: ITS-S service
entry.definition: <ITS-S> performance of one or more tasks to fulfil an ITS-S user need for an ITS-S user

entry.name: ITS-S service
entry.definition: <ITS-S> performance of one or more tasks to fulfil an ITS-S user need for an ITS-S user

entry.name: ITS-S service provider
entry.definition: <ITS-S> ITS-S that delivers one or more ITS-S services

entry.name: ITS-S user
entry.definition: <ITS-S> entity that has an ITS-S user need to be fulfilled

entry.name: ITS-S user need
entry.definition: <ITS-S> need for processing within a bounded, secure, managed domain

entry.name: ITS-S communication need
entry.definition: <ITS-S> need for communication functionality that connects an ITS-S to other nodes

entry.name: ITS-S communication process
entry.definition: <ITS-S> entity that delivers one or more ITS-S communication services

entry.name: ITS-S communication service
entry.definition: <ITS-S> performance of one or more tasks to fulfil an ITS-S communication need for an ITS-S communication user

entry.name: ITS-S communication service
entry.definition: <ITS-S> performance of one or more tasks to fulfil an ITS-S communication need for an ITS-S communication user

entry.definition: <ITS-S> performance of one or more tasks to fulfil an ITS-S communication need for an ITS-S communication user

entry.name: ITS-S communication user
entry.definition: <ITS-S> entity that has an ITS-S communication need to be fulfilled

entry.name: public transport
entry.definition: transport service that is publicly accessible enabling the movement of one or more persons

entry.name: public transport
entry.definition: transport service that is publicly accessible enabling the movement of one or more persons

entry.name: shared transport service
entry.definition: transport service that relies upon the same resources to fulfil the transport needs of multiple unrelated transport users and where the transport provider has the primary responsibility for the operation of the transport mode

entry.name: shared transport service
entry.definition: transport service that relies upon the same resources to fulfil the transport needs of multiple unrelated transport users and where the transport provider has the primary responsibility for the operation of the transport mode

entry.name: shared vehicle service
entry.definition: transport service that sequentially provides the same vehicles to multiple unrelated transport users and where the transport user has the primary responsibility for the operation of the vehicle

entry.name: shared vehicle service
entry.definition: transport service that sequentially provides the same vehicles to multiple unrelated transport users and where the transport user has the primary responsibility for the operation of the vehicle

entry.name: transport sharing
entry.definition: using a shared transport service

entry.name: vehicle sharing
entry.definition: using a shared vehicle service

entry.name: contractual model
entry.definition: legal framework for the agreement between a service provider and a user

entry.name: corporate customer model
entry.definition: contractual model where the user is a commercial entity

entry.name: government customer model
entry.definition: contractual model where the user is a governmental entity

entry.name: peer-to-peer model
entry.definition: private customer model where the service provider is an individual

entry.name: private customer model
entry.definition: contractual model where the user is an individual

entry.name: commercial
entry.definition: financial model where services are provided with a profit motive

entry.name: cooperative
entry.definition: financial model where users partner to defray the costs of a service

entry.name: financial model
entry.definition: economic framework for the agreement between a service provider and a user

entry.name: fractional ownership
entry.definition: cooperative financial model where users partner to support the purchase, maintenance, and overhead costs associated with a service

entry.name: membership-based
entry.definition: characteristic of a financial model that requires users to enter into an agreement prior to receiving services

entry.name: mutual benefit
entry.definition: cooperative financial model where users partner on a per-use basis

entry.name: open-access
entry.definition: characteristic of a financial model that does not require membership within an organization to receive services

entry.name: private
entry.definition: financial model where services are provided to members of the owning organization without usage fees

entry.name: public
entry.definition: financial model where services are provided by an administrative authority in an attempt to better serve societal interests

entry.name: concurrent
entry.definition: operational model where services might be provided to multiple users at any one time

entry.name: dynamic route
entry.definition: <transport service> concurrent operation where transported items can only be received or delivered at stopping points within a pre-defined service corridor

entry.name: fixed route
entry.definition: <transport service> concurrent operation where transported items can only be received or delivered at stopping points contained in a pre-defined sequence

entry.name: operational model
entry.definition: logistical framework for the agreement between a service provider and a user

entry.name: paired on-demand
entry.definition: <transport service> concurrent operation where the transport provider may choose to divert from its path to service a new request from another transport user while servicing an earlier transport consumer

entry.name: sequential
entry.definition: operational model where services are provided to a single user at any one time

entry.name: free-floating
entry.definition: <transport service> network model where the transport service may be initiated and terminated at any location meeting basic criteria

entry.name: network model
entry.definition: infrastructure framework for the agreement between a service provider and a user

entry.name: station-based one-way
entry.definition: <transport service> operational mode where the transport service is initiated and terminated at two different facilities managed by the transport provider

entry.name: station-based roundtrip
entry.definition: <transport service> operational mode where the transport service is initiated and terminated at the same facility managed by the transport provider

entry.name: courier network service
entry.definition: commercial, peer-to-peer shared transport service that transports goods

entry.name: rideshare service
entry.definition: cooperative shared transport service that transports passengers concurrently

entry.name: ridesourced service
entry.definition: commercial, peer-to-peer shared transport service that transports passengers

entry.name: ridesplit service
entry.definition: ridesourced service that serves passengers concurrently

entry.name: shuttle service
entry.definition: shared transport service that transports passengers between two specified locations

entry.name: shuttle service
entry.definition: shared transport service that transports passengers between two specified locations

entry.name: taxi service
entry.definition: commercial shared transport service that transports passengers sequentially

entry.name: taxi-share service
entry.definition: commercial shared transport service that transports passengers concurrently

entry.name: bikesharing service
entry.definition: shared vehicle service that shares bicycles

entry.name: carsharing service
entry.definition: shared vehicle service that shares passenger cars

entry.name: B2C mobility sharing app
entry.definition: mobility app that assists a transport user in acquiring a transport service from a specific business

entry.name: mobility app
entry.definition: ITS-S application implementation designed to assist an individual transport consumer in understanding transport-related information, making decisions, and/or acting upon decisions

entry.name: navigation app
entry.definition: mobility app that assists a transport user to determine the best route to a destination

entry.name: P2P mobility sharing app
entry.definition: mobility app that assists a transport user in acquiring a transport service from an individual that participates in the mobility app's network

entry.name: public transport app
entry.definition: mobility app that assists a transport user in using a public transport system

entry.name: public transport app
entry.definition: mobility app that assists a transport user in using a public transport system

entry.name: real-time traveller information app
entry.definition: mobility app that provides information about current travel conditions to a transport user

entry.name: ridesourcing app
entry.definition: P2P mobility sharing app for acquiring a ridesourced service

entry.name: taxi hailing app
entry.definition: mobility app that assists a transport user in electronically requesting a taxi

entry.name: trip aggregator app
entry.definition: mobility app that assists a transport user in planning trips that may span multiple vehicle modes or transport providers

entry.name: pedestrian
entry.definition: person who is travelling on foot

entry.name: road user
entry.definition: mobile material entity within the road reservation

entry.name: traveller
entry.definition: person, in the role of a transport item, who is headed to a destination

entry.name: driver
entry.definition: person that is currently responsible for the dynamic driving task for the vehicle

entry.name: driver
entry.definition: person that is currently responsible for the dynamic driving task for the vehicle

entry.name: in-vehicle driver
entry.definition: driver that performs the dynamic driving task using the vehicle's built-in input devices to control the longitudinal and lateral movement of the vehicle

entry.name: in-vehicle driver
entry.definition: driver that performs the dynamic driving task using the vehicle's built-in input devices to control the longitudinal and lateral movement of the vehicle

entry.name: passenger
entry.definition: person who has a reservation to travel or is travelling in a vehicle except for any crew, staff, or drivers

entry.name: remote driver
entry.definition: driver that performs the dynamic driving task without using the vehicle's built-in input devices to control the longitudinal and lateral movement of the vehicle

entry.name: remote driver
entry.definition: driver that performs the dynamic driving task without using the vehicle's built-in input devices to control the longitudinal and lateral movement of the vehicle

entry.name: vehicle occupant
entry.definition: person in or on a vehicle

entry.name: built-in vehicle input device
entry.definition: input device designed to be physically connected to a vehicle and to remain connected even when the vehicle is not in use

entry.name: input device
entry.definition: <vehicle> material entity that can affect the vehicle's operation

entry.name: motor
entry.definition: material entity that converts energy into mechanical motion

entry.name: nomadic vehicle input device
entry.definition: input device capable to be carried into, or in near proximity of, a vehicle and connected as desired

entry.name: nomadic vehicle input device
entry.definition: input device capable to be carried into, or in near proximity of, a vehicle and connected as desired

entry.name: remote vehicle input device
entry.definition: input device designed to be electronically connected to a vehicle even when the vehicle is not in close proximity

entry.name: vehicle
entry.definition: material entity designed to transport people or physical goods by changing its physical position

entry.name: vehicle
entry.definition: material entity designed to transport people or physical goods by changing its physical position

entry.name: vehicle
entry.definition: material entity designed to transport people or physical goods by changing its physical position

entry.name: wheel
entry.definition: circular material entity that rotates about an axle to facilitate movement of the vehicle

entry.name: design speed
entry.definition: <vehicle> maximum speed at which a vehicle is intended to operate for a sustained period of time

entry.name: speed
entry.definition: rate of change of a material entities position with respect to a frame of reference

entry.name: speed
entry.definition: rate of change of a material entities position with respect to a frame of reference

entry.name: ADS
entry.definition: driving automation system that is able to perform the entire DDT on a sustained basis

entry.name: ADS-dedicated vehicle
entry.definition: ADS-equipped vehicle designed for only driverless operation for complete trips

entry.name: ADS-equipped vehicle
entry.definition: vehicle integrated with an ADS

entry.name: ADS-equipped vehicle
entry.definition: vehicle integrated with an ADS

entry.name: conventional vehicle
entry.definition: <driving automation> vehicle designed to be operated by a person during part or all of every trip.

entry.name: DDT performance-relevant system failure
entry.definition: malfunction in a vehicle system that prevents the driving automation system from reliably performing its portion of the DDT on a sustained basis

entry.name: driver spport system
entry.definition: driving automation system that is only able to perform part of the DDT

entry.name: driving automation system
entry.definition: hardware and software system that is able to perform part or all of the DDT on a sustained basis

entry.name: dual-mode vehicle
entry.definition: <driving automation> ADS-equipped vehicle designed for both driverless operation and operation by a conventional driver for complete trips

entry.name: dynamic driving task
entry.definition: all real-time operational and tactical functions required to operate a vehicle in on-road traffic

entry.name: fallback
entry.definition: <driving automation> response by a person to perform the DDT or by an ADS to achieve a minimal risk condition when the response is triggered upon violation of the defined operational design domain constraints or in response to a DDT performance-relevant driving automation system failure

entry.name: fallback-ready user
entry.definition: <driving automation> person who is able to operate the vehicle if the Level 3 ADS issues a request to intervene or if s/he otherwise identifies a condition that requires intervention to perform the DDT

entry.name: level 1 driving automation
entry.definition: driver support system that provides either sustained lateral or sustained longitudinal vehicle motion control within a specific operational design domain with the expectation that a conventional driver completes the dynamic driving task

entry.name: level 2 driving automation
entry.definition: driver support system that provides sustained lateral and longitudinal vehicle motion control within a specific operational design domain with the expectation that a conventional driver completes the object and event detection and response

entry.name: level 3 ADS
entry.definition: ADS designed with the expectation that the fallback-ready user is available to intervene

entry.name: level 3 ADS
entry.definition: ADS designed with the expectation that the fallback-ready user is available to intervene

entry.name: level 4 ADS
entry.definition: ADS that is capable of operating within a specific ODD and providing its own fallback, without any expectation that a human driver will respond to a request to intervene

entry.name: level 4 ADS
entry.definition: ADS that is capable of operating within a specific ODD and providing its own fallback, without any expectation that a human driver will respond to a request to intervene

entry.name: level 5 ADS
entry.definition: ADS that is capable of unconditional (i.e., not ODD-specific) operation and providing its own fallback, without any expectation that a human driver will respond to a request to intervene

entry.name: level 5 ADS
entry.definition: ADS that is capable of unconditional (i.e., not ODD-specific) operation and providing its own fallback, without any expectation that a human driver will respond to a request to intervene

entry.name: operational design domain
entry.definition: set of operating conditions under which a given driving automation system or feature thereof is specifically designed to function

entry.name: disconnected
entry.definition: characteristic of a material entity that is or was equipped with communications equipment that is sufficiently physically disconnected such that the vehicle is no longer able to send data to or receive data from connected entities

entry.name: disconnected
entry.definition: characteristic of a material entity that is or was equipped with communications equipment that is sufficiently physically disconnected such that the vehicle is no longer able to send data to or receive data from connected entities

entry.name: disconnected
entry.definition: characteristic of a material entity that is or was equipped with communications equipment that is sufficiently physically disconnected such that the vehicle is no longer able to send data to or receive data from connected entities

entry.name: off-grid
entry.definition: characteristic of a material entity that is currently unable to send data to or receive data from connected entities

entry.name: off-grid
entry.definition: characteristic of a material entity that is currently unable to send data to or receive data from connected entities

entry.name: off-grid
entry.definition: characteristic of a material entity that is currently unable to send data to or receive data from connected entities

entry.name: unconnected
entry.definition: characteristic of a material entity that is equipped with communications equipment that is not active or is otherwise unable to send data to or receive data from connected entities

entry.name: unconnected
entry.definition: characteristic of a material entity that is equipped with communications equipment that is not active or is otherwise unable to send data to or receive data from connected entities

entry.name: unconnected
entry.definition: characteristic of a material entity that is equipped with communications equipment that is not active or is otherwise unable to send data to or receive data from connected entities

entry.name: unequipped
entry.definition: characteristic of a material entity that is not and has never been equipped with communications equipment for sending data to or receiving data from connected entities

entry.name: unequipped
entry.definition: characteristic of a material entity that is not and has never been equipped with communications equipment for sending data to or receiving data from connected entities

entry.name: unequipped
entry.definition: characteristic of a material entity that is not and has never been equipped with communications equipment for sending data to or receiving data from connected entities

entry.name: high vehicle speed
entry.definition: speed of a vehicle that exceeds free flow motorway speeds by a factor of two or more

entry.name: high-speed vehicle
entry.definition: vehicle with a design speed in the range of high vehicle speeds

entry.name: low vehicle speed
entry.definition: speed of a vehicle that exceeds pedestrian speeds and is more typical of pedal cycles

entry.name: low-speed vehicle
entry.definition: vehicle with a design speed in the range of low vehicle speeds

entry.name: moderate vehicle speed
entry.definition: speed of a vehicle that exceeds moderately-low vehicle speeds but does not reach free-flow motorway speeds

entry.name: moderately high vehicle speed
entry.definition: speed of a vehicle that is typical of free-flow motorway speeds to twice that speed

entry.name: moderately high-speed vehicle
entry.definition: vehicle with a design speed in the range of moderately-high vehicle speeds

entry.name: moderately low vehicle speed
entry.definition: speed of a vehicle that exceeds speeds typical of pedal cycles but can be reached on performance pedal cycles in short bursts or by performance riders

entry.name: moderately low-speed vehicle
entry.definition: vehicle with a design speed in the range of moderately-low vehicle speeds

entry.name: moderate-speed vehicle
entry.definition: vehicle with a design speed in the range of moderate vehicle speeds

entry.name: ultra-low vehicle speed
entry.definition: speed of a vehicle that does not greatly exceed typical pedestrian speeds

entry.name: ultra-low-speed vehicle
entry.definition: vehicle with a design speed that does not exceed ultra-low vehicle speeds

entry.name: motor vehicle
entry.definition: motorized road vehicle allowed to operate in the same driving spaces as motorized passenger cars

entry.name: motor vehicle
entry.definition: motorized road vehicle allowed to operate in the same driving spaces as motorized passenger cars

entry.name: motorized vehicle
entry.definition: self-propelled vehicle

entry.name: motorized vehicle
entry.definition: self-propelled vehicle

entry.name: non-road cycle
entry.definition: human-powered vehicle not meeting the legal requirements to be driven in cycle lanes

entry.name: non-road cycle
entry.definition: human-powered vehicle not meeting the legal requirements to be driven in cycle lanes

entry.name: non-road vehicle
entry.definition: vehicle not meeting the legal requirements to be driven in traffic lanes or cycle lanes of a road network

entry.name: non-road vehicle
entry.definition: vehicle not meeting the legal requirements to be driven in traffic lanes or cycle lanes of a road network

entry.name: road cycle
entry.definition: vehicle meeting the legal requirements to operate in cycle lanes and cycleways

entry.name: road cycle
entry.definition: vehicle meeting the legal requirements to operate in cycle lanes and cycleways

entry.name: road vehicle
entry.definition: vehicle meeting the requirements to operate within the driving space of a road
